title: How to Maintain Your PlayStation 3

steps.headline: Every day, get a thin cloth like the ones that come with laptops to clean the keyboard and case.
steps.description: Rub it all over the PS3 to get rid of dust and small lint.

steps.headline: Make sure not to use your PS3 for prolonged hours.
Turn it off frequently to ensure that the console does not overheat.
Also ensure that the console is not too close to a wall.
If the dirt on the PS3 is more than just dust, grab a squeezed, dampened cloth and rub the very top of the PlayStation, then carefully moving the cloth down to near the power button.
Every few weeks, disconnect all the cables from the PS3 and put the console on a clean, cold surface such as a couch.
steps.description: This will give the power supply a break from the hot electricity. Put it all back after twenty minutes.

steps.headline: Wipe the cables clean of dust.
Turn on the PlayStation 3 and delete any games you no longer play, unless they are Blu-Ray discs.
steps.description: If they are, then just remove them and put them in their case. Organize the files on the XMB and shut off the PS3.

steps.headline: Make sure you delete the messages in your inbox and outbox.
steps.description: This can slow down your system and take up useful memory if it gets too full.

steps.headline: Repeat these steps each week or so.

text: Every day, get a thin cloth like the ones that come with laptops to clean the keyboard and case. Rub it all over the PS3 to get rid of dust and small lint. Make sure not to use your PS3 for prolonged hours.  Turn it off frequently to ensure that the console does not overheat.  Also ensure that the console is not too close to a wall.  If the dirt on the PS3 is more than just dust, grab a squeezed, dampened cloth and rub the very top of the PlayStation, then carefully moving the cloth down to near the power button.  Every few weeks, disconnect all the cables from the PS3 and put the console on a clean, cold surface such as a couch. This will give the power supply a break from the hot electricity. Put it all back after twenty minutes. Wipe the cables clean of dust.  Turn on the PlayStation 3 and delete any games you no longer play, unless they are Blu-Ray discs. If they are, then just remove them and put them in their case. Organize the files on the XMB and shut off the PS3. Make sure you delete the messages in your inbox and outbox. This can slow down your system and take up useful memory if it gets too full. Repeat these steps each week or so.
